page.title: 18THE BRISTOL CHANNEL
page.content: This area of the Bristol Channel sees one of the largest rises and falls in the tide in the world.Low tide reveals a vast expanse of mud. It is said that Turner came to Kewstoke to capture on canvas the marvellous sunsets that often grace the evening sky. Fishermen enjoy their sport from the shore or from small boats but there is hardly a good living to be made for the professional. The traffic on the shipping lanes of the Channel provides a source of interest that constantly changes.In the middle to July 1985 the submarine H.M.S. Oracle was spotted of Sand Bay on its way to Bristol. On clear days the mountains of Wales are clearly visible.
